abstract_summ: During the initial pandemic wave of COVID-19, apart from common presenting symptoms (cough, fever, and fatigue), many countries have reported a sudden increase in the number of smell and taste dysfunction patients.We also discuss the possibility of using "smell and taste loss" as a screening tool for COVID-19 and treatment options in the post-SARS-CoV-2 infectious olfactory loss.However, loss of smell could be presented in COVID-19 patients without other rhinologic symptoms or significant nasal inflammation.The device is designed to work with a mobile app that can trigger selected smell or combinations and further can be programmed to give standard or customised smell tests.This review aims to provide a brief overview of recent evidence for epidemiology, pathological mechanisms for the smell, and taste dysfunction in SARS-CoV-2 infected patients.
